column4: os-prober detects my installation of Win XP-64 on a second hard drive, but Grub2 will not load it. Where should I start to fix it?
Try running "ls -l" in the grub shell at boot and see if your second drive is listed.
thanks, will do.
the second hard drive is listed as "Partition table. Filesystem unrecognized"
Are you using gpt on either of the drives?
i'm not sure what that is, so probably not
Is one of the drives over two TB large?
yes, one is a 2 TB drive, so it's listed as larger than 2000 GB
that's the ubuntu drive, and it's working fine
Try adding "insmod part_msdos" to /etc/grub.d/40_custom then re-run update-grub.
will do. thanks.
You're welcome.
the output for update-grub says "can't read 'part_msdos': No such file or directory
Add "insmod part_msdos" on a new line at the end of /etc/grub.d/40_custom, not the beginning.
yeah, i just realized i overwrote the whole 40_custom file. any way i can regenerate it?
Here's what the file contains by default: http://paste.debian.net/81269/
ok, great. i'll reboot and brb
winXP boots up perfectly. you're a wizard!
thanks a ton.
You're welcome.
You're Ubuntu drive is using GPT just so you know for future reference.
